name: Jovenes Education and Empowerment Program (JEEP)
description: The JEEP Program is a bilingual, 16-week peer leadership experience designed for Latinx male-identified youth (14-17) to explore healthy masculinity, cultural identity, and leadership. Meeting three times a week after school, JEEP provides a safe space for undocumented, newcomer, indigenous, and native-born youth to challenge harmful gender norms and build integrity-driven relationships. Through workshops, facilitation training, and community projects, participants develop self-awareness, public

howToGetIt: Contact: Sebastian Perez, JEEP Program Coordinator (415) 723-1344 / sperez@horizons-sf.org To Apply: Online Application Eligibility/Commitment - Young men between the ages of 14-17 - Complete 6 months educational training - Attend Programming: 3 times per week; Monday, Wednesday & Fridays, from 4:30 â€“ 6:30pm - Develop youth-led project
agency: Horizons Unlimited of San Francisco, Inc
